body_html:
I don't know if there is a specific place to discuss this, but @shoyer was active in the typing stuff. Maybe he or @njsmith who is working on the numpy improvements has an idea.

Also @breuleux is working on something similar here:https://github.com/mila-udem/myia and @alexbw here https://github.com/google/tangent.

Then there was an idea for a PyIR by @njsmith so that all the python compilers can talk to each other.

Would be great if everyone can get together and agree on a type system and IR so that we can have synergy from people's work and reduce standards proliferation and code fragmentation.

Also @breuleux is working on something similar here:https://github.com/mila-udem/myia  and @alexbw here https://github.com/google/tangent.
Then there was an idea for a PyIR by @njsmith so that all the python compilers can talk to each other.
Would be great if everyone can get together and agree on a type system and IR so that we can have synergy from people's work and reduce standards proliferation  and code fragmentation.
body:
I don't know if there is a specific place to discuss this, but  @shoyer was active in the typing stuff. Maybe he or  @njsmith who is working on the numpy improvements  has an idea.

Also @breuleux is working on something similar here:https://github.com/mila-udem/myia  and @alexbw here https://github.com/google/tangent. 

Then there was an idea for a PyIR by @njsmith so that all the python compilers can talk to each other. 

Would be great if everyone can get together and agree on a type system and IR so that we can have synergy from people's work and reduce standards proliferation  and code fragmentation.
